name: neko
description: Neko is a self-hosted virtual browser running in Docker. It streams browser sessions as video to clients over WebRTC, making it ideal for collaboration, testing, or remote browsing with shared access.
features: Virtual browser streaming: Run browsers in Docker containers and stream sessions via WebRTC to multiple users.
Shared control: Multiple users can view and control the same browser session simultaneously.
Multiple browser support: Choose from Firefox, Chromium, or other browsers for different use cases.
Low latency: WebRTC technology provides near-instant response times for interactive browsing.
Access control: Manage who can view or control sessions with user permissions and locks.
File upload/download: Transfer files between local machines and the virtual browser environment.
Clipboard sync: Copy and paste content between local system and remote browser session.
Audio streaming: Share browser audio with all connected users in real-time.
Session persistence: Keep browser state and tabs alive between user connections.
Collaborative testing: Test websites together with team members in a shared environment.
Privacy isolation: Browse from a containerized environment separate from your main system.
Custom resolutions: Adjust virtual display size to match different device viewports for testing.
